discreteness: Proto-particles must form discrete, separable regions in the semantic manifold; overlapping identity cores are disallowed unless forming composite states governed by Σ.
interaction_stability: Under small proto-force perturbations, the identity tuple S must remain invariant (structural stability).
finite_support_or_fast_decay: Ψ*, λ*, μ* associated with P must either have finite support or decay sufficiently fast to maintain Ω-integrals.
non_spontaneous_creation: New proto-particles must arise via attractor formation from FSMs, not from arbitrary assignments.
omega_compatibility: All proto-particles must satisfy Ω’s global invariants: total curvature, μ-budget, ψ-norm, and layer hierarchy.
rank_preservation: Proto-particle formation may reorganize values on D_{ijk…} but may not change rank unless explicitly mediated by a ρ-governed meta-transition.
